doc.wiki: In grammar, sentence and clause structure, commonly known as sentence composition, is the classification of sentences based on the number and kind of clauses in their syntactic structure. Such division is an element of traditional grammar. In standard English, sentences are composed of five clause patterns: 1. Subject + Verb (intransitive) (as in "She runs to the meeting") 2. Subject + Verb (transitive) + Object (as in "She runs the meeting")
